name: PARTH SHAH
intro: Hi there! Nice to meet you :)
Scroll down to know me better!
about:
I love to get involved in the entire lifecycle of a product - from brainstorming ideas, design, implementation, management, marketing to support. At Abilitare, I help build the head-controlled mouse, which is a hands-free alternative for those with hand disabilities to operate computers and smartphones.

When not helping the disabled gain digital access, I like fooling around with deep learning architectures, cooking and sketching.

abilitare.title: Abilitare
abilitare.desc:
Abilitare enables those with hand disabities with hands-free access to smartphones and computers. A sensor worn behind the ear tracks user's head movements and makes the mouse cursor move accordingly. Simply put, look up to make the cursor move up, look down to move it down or look left or right to make the mouse cursor move sideways.
With this head-controlled mouse, we aim to empower them with the same level of productivity with smart devices as everyone else at work, school, or home.

big_idea.title: BrainForce wins $25,000 in 2021 Big Idea Competition
big_idea.subtitle: Warrington College of Business: Newsroom
big_idea.desc:
Brainforce is now Abilitare! www.abilitare.com
We continue or mission to help those with hand disabilities gain access to computers and smartphones.

thesis.title: Master's thesis
thesis.subtitle: Learnt lossy data compression for large scientific simultations
thesis.desc: With checkpoint file sizes reaching into exabytes, I/O bottlenecks pose a significant challenge for modern large scale scientific simulations. This thesis proposes two learnt techniques to provide high degrees of compression, albeit lossy, to significantly reduce a checkpoint’s size. It is shown that these methods compare favorably with the leading lossy compressors like ZFP and offer far higher compression ratios than lossless compressors like Gzip. The first method utilizes tucker decomposition while the second uses autoencoders for reducing the dimensionality of floating point tensors. Both are subsequently coupled with the product quantizer to efficiently discretize floating point numbers into integers. The popular OpenFOAM toolkit and the exascale XGC simulator are used to evaluate compression errors.

vae.title: Scientific data compression
vae.subtitle: Modern Artificial Intelligence and Learning Technologies (MALT) lab
vae.desc:
(In Progress)
Designing novel State-of-the-art architectures for autoencoders and variational autoencoders for high dimensional data compression/generation. This is in support of exascale computing at the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory and in collaboration with Oak Ridge National Laboratory.
Advisors: Dr. Ranka and Dr. Rangarajan

atspm.title: Temporal data - Traffic estimation
atspm.subtitle: Modern Artificial Intelligence and Learning Technologies (MALT) lab
atspm.desc:
Estimation of travel times and queue lengths at signalized road intersections by analysing data from Automated Traffic Signal Performance Measures (ATSPM). In simple terms, induction loop sensors record vehicles passing over them. This data can be used to estimate traffic conditions.

Accepted for presentation at the 23rd Intelligent Transportation Systems Conference (IEEE ITSC 2020)

* This work is supported by NSF CNS 1922782, by the Florida Dept. of Transportation (FDOT) and FDOT District 5.

iheal.title: Intelligent ICU
iheal.subtitle: Intelligent Health Systems Lab (i-Heal)
iheal.desc: Transforming patient care in the Intensive Care Unit by developing autonomous monitoring tools using advanced machine learning techniques. Currently, many critical care indices are not captured automatically at a granular level, rather are repetitively assessed by overburdened nurses. In this pilot study, the lab examined the feasibility of using pervasive sensing technology and artiﬁcial intelligence for autonomous and granular monitoring in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

ruleStudio.title: Visual programming - Rule studio
ruleStudio.desc: Built a proprietary drag and drop tool to aid creation of domain specific rules. Led the end-to-end process from ideation and architecture design to production and CI/CD. My proposal of utilizing visual programming led to an improvement of 80% in the average turn around time of a rule. Visual programming library: Google blockly

liveSense.title: HERE Live Sense SDK
liveSense.desc:
Rapid prototyping, R&D and a technical feasibility study for a new product. Successful completion of the same led to the eventual release of the HERE LiveSense SDK. This SDK provided critical alerts and hazard awareness to drivers using object detection. It also automated collection of fresh map data in the background.

Real-time object detection, multi-object tracking and distance estimation from 2d image stream, on edge devices with hardware constraints was very challenging as well as fun to solve. We worked on Android as well as iOS versions of the SDK.

duppoi.title: Duplicate Points of Interests
duppoi.desc:
Crowdsourced or data aggregated from different sources causes a lot of duplicate places in geospatial data. This project aimed to reduce/eliminate human work hours required to identify and remove such duplicates.

The real challenge of the project was to understand the needs of Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and concretize the problem statement. Subsequently, implementing, rigorous testing and large scale deployment of the models was also a fun process.

fml.title: Course project - alphabet recognition
fml.desc: Final project for the course (EEL5840) Fundamentals of Machine Learning. Achieved the highest test accuracy on the classification task amongst all submissions in the class.

dss.title: Course project - decision support system
dss.desc: Final project for the course Human Computer Interfaces. The aim was to create decision support sytem for course administrators and course creators and also to facilitate student registrations.

garbage.title: Smart Monitoring System
garbage.desc: Handling the massive amounts of garbage produced in typical Indian cities has always been a tough job for the local administrators. The aim of this project was to make a smart monitoring system which will provide vital logistical support to the civic bodies in solid waste management.

noc.title: Network-on-chip
noc.subtitle: Fault tolerant application specific network-on-chip
noc.desc:
Network-on-chip is a big component of the state-of-the-art chip architectures today. In this publication we propose a greedy algorithm to generate fault tolerant network topologies which performs better than the classic minimum spanning tree or the popular De-Bruijn’s algorithm on metrics like the communication cost and hardware requirements.

This work is partially supported by the research project No. ECR/2016/001389 dt. 06/03/2017, sponsored by the SERB, Govt. of India.

Publication: 10.1109/ISED.2017.8303920
P. Shah, A. Kanniganti and J. Soumya, "Fault-tolerant application specific Network-on-Chip design," 2017 7th International Symposium on Embedded Computing and System Design (ISED), Durgapur, 2017, pp. 1-5.

this.title: This website
this.desc:
An open and free interactive live resume template. Designed from scratch and implemented using the Vue.js framework.

A bit of recursion is always fun! Use this template for your own site.
